analysis.career_trajectory: Started with C programming in 2012, moved to Ruby development with the creation of a lightweight Ruby implementation in 2014. Continued working on various projects, including lock-free queue implementations and keyboard controller firmware for Atmel AVR and ARM USB families. In 2020, started exploring mini mruby compiler integrated with mruby/c VM for one-chip microcontroller. Recently worked on process module for mruby and a prototype of stream based programming language.

comment_analytics.communication_style: Engaging and in-depth, often discussing the root cause of issues and exploring alternative solutions.

match_profile.similar_user_traits: A developer who is passionate about system programming and Ruby development.
conversation_starters: What inspired you to explore system programming?
How do you approach debugging complex issues in your codebase?
Can you share an experience where you had to optimize performance in a critical section of your code?
